intro: Acronia stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf acronia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive, finely divided structure, and its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbels. Acronia stricta typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in open woodlands. It is a perennial herb that plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences.
